subs.text: Nikola Jokic: "The job is done, we can go home now."

I've been writing about Bluesky lately, and will be doing more in the coming days and weeks. I've been getting requests from friends to get them invites, but this isn't my platform. I'm just a developer. And it's just one platform. And I'm just one person.

I've got a list of outstanding questions about Bluesky from a developer perspective. Any help much appreciated. I have a feeling when this is done we may have a Busy Developer's Guide to the basics of Bluesky programming.
For now, small is beautiful
People are concerned that Bluesky is so small. I'm not, I like that it's small, and I also like that there are no peers yet.
Some part of me thinks the future of social networks is small, that we've seen how unwieldy they can be when they grow too huge.
I also think we have to work on a cross-platform API like the one we had with blogging. It didn't take long to create, and it was supported everywhere. WordPress still supports the API.

The idea of every social network having their own API is workable if and only if we can put a layer on top of them that makes it possible to communicate with all. It'd be analogous to TCP/IP and the start of the internet. Peering is everything and then data formats. We have good prior art for that too.
All we're waiting for is people to work together. It doesn't have to be everyone, just people who want to build something bigger than one particular brand of social network.
Uncle Sam doesn't ask
Romney: "Trump didn't turn over documents when asked to."
We're too deferential to Trump, it's in the language.
The government doesn't ask for its secret documents to be returned.
If it were you or I, we'd be ordered to return them, arrested until they were returned, convicted and then incarcerated.
"Ask?" Uncle Sam doesn't ask.
This isn't Macy's
Many years ago I got a call from the IRS saying I owed them money. I was told the amount.
The agent asked when I'd be sending the money.
I asked them to send me a detailed bill.
The agent said no.
"This isn't Macy's, Mr Winer" he said.
I sent the money.
